alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Lycoming; Sullivan; Tioga (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 10:13AM EST until January 14 at 10:45AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... North central Clinton County in north central Pennsylvania... Northwestern Lycoming County in north central Pennsylvania... Northwestern Sullivan County in north central Pennsylvania... Tioga County in north central Pennsylvania... * Until 1045 AM EST. * At 1012 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Caton to Glen Union, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Route 6 from northwest of Wellsboro to the Bradford county line. Route 15 from Oak Lynn to Lawrenceville. State Road 14 from Trout Run to the Bradford County line. State Road 120 near Hyner View State Park. Locations impacted include... Mansfield, Wellsboro, Morris, Blossburg, Lawrenceville, Covington, Arnot, Millerton, Waterville, Ralston, Cedar Run, and Cammal. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
